result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather A Westlund was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Established - $15.00 today, then $25.00/month thereafter
Probation Revoked, sentenced to jail, 3/13/18
Attorney Tim Gebert

2:09 Defendant Heather A Westlund in court with attorney Timothy S. Gebert.  Defendant Heather A Westlund in custody.  Leigh Neville Neil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Neville Neil makes statement and recommends 6 month jail sentence for each count concurrent.
Attorney Gebert makes statement and concurs with recommendation.
Court sentences defendant to 9 months jail on count 2 and 6 months jail on count 3 concurrent with each other and concurrent with Waushara County case.

3:05 Defendant Heather A Westlund in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing and enters plea of not guilty to all counts. Attorney Lennon requests that defendant's cash bond be reduced or amended to signature bond and cash bond returned to poster. State objects to bond modification. Court amends cash bond to $500. Balance to be returned to poster. All conditions remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 11:00 am.
